caption:
Hey enthusiastic developers and designers, we're here with our recruitment test!

Test Instructions:
The test will consist of 4 sections, Probability and Puzzles, Development and Design, Algorithms and Pseudo code and HR questions and is of 1.5hrs(7PM to 8:30PM) duration.
The test will begin at 7PM sharp so all students are requested to reach the venue 15-20mins in advance accordingly.
Do follow us as we'll update the venue on all our socials.
Feel free to reach out to us for any other doubts.
See you guys there and all the best!

Exciting news, aspiring developers and designers! We're EXTENDING THE DEADLINE for our recruitment assignments by 48 hours (24th March 11:59PM)

Plus, we've released some MINI ASSIGNMENTS for you to attempt instead of the original assignments. Check them out using the QR code or the link in our bio.

Happy coding!

üì£ Attention development and design enthusiasts! MDG Space is announcing the release of our recruitment assignments. Are you looking for an opportunity to prove your skills and showcase your talent? Then these assignments are just what you need!

Scan the QR or visit the link in our bio to access the assignments and get started today!

üì¢ Attention, aspiring designers and developers! Are you looking to join a dynamic and innovative group of techies? Join us on March 14th at 6:30pm in the MAC auditorium for MDGSpace's recruitment talk. We'll talk about our group and the different tracks for getting recruited. Don't miss this chance to network and learn more! üöÄ

We couldn't keep you waiting any longer! We present to you the amazing developers and designers selected for the Season of Code and Design üéâ Heartiest congratulations to all! Those who couldn't make it, don't be disheartened, we got a lot of really great entries and it was really hard to select a few. No worries, we still have a lot coming your way!

Attention all designers! üé® Get ready to delve into the world of design and discover the magic of user-centered design process ‚ú®

Join us for an exciting workshop on the 12th of February at 6:30 PM where we'll be exploring the ins and outs of what it means to design. Topics covered include ideation, prototyping, interactive research, and design psychology üéØ

This workshop is a must-attend for anyone looking to improve their design skills and take their creative thinking to the next level. üöÄ

Mark the date and keep an eye on our Instagram handle for the venue üìç update. Don't miss out on this opportunity to expand your design knowledge and network with like-minded individuals. See you there!

Calling all tech wizards and design masterminds! MDG Space's Season of Code & Design offers a unique opportunity for you to work on real-world problems, learn from the best in the business, and turn your ideas into a reality.

This program is open to both first and second yearites, and has two tracks: Development (SoC) and Design (SoD). Check out the links in our bio to view the problem statements and submit your proposal.

Don't let a lack of experience hold you back ‚Äì you'll be mentored throughout by past participants in prestigious programs like GSoC, MLH, and LFX. (Additionally, developers can also participate in teams if a project seems challenging.)

And don't forget, being part of this program could be your ticket to direct interview for MDG Space recruitments for freshers.

"Hey everyone, MDG Week is finally here! Get ready to dive into the exciting world of development. Our lecture series is jam-packed with information on the latest and greatest technologies that will give you the skills to build the future.

During the week, we'll be covering everything from Software Development to hot topics like Django, Flutter, and React. Not only will you learn some awesome new skills, but you'll also be prepping yourself for those MDG recruitments. Don't miss out on this opportunity to learn from some amazing people and build some cool stuff!"

Hi everyone! Hope you had a good ETE period üòÑ

Now, to change the pace, our seniors at MDG Space are here to share some Dos and Don'ts of the Open Source world. They have tons of insight into and experience with Open Source programs like GSoC, Outreachy, MLH and LFX, and memories both sweet and sour.

So join our livestream and get ready to take notes on 3rd December 4:00 PM on our YouTube channel @MDGIITR: (link in QR and bio)

You can fill this form with any doubts you have; we'll answer them all in our talk: (link in bio)

See ya there!!
.
.
.
.
.
.

Sup folks!!

Here's the anticipated launch we announced in our Intro Talk- our latest and updated version of Codephile!

Codephile is a social networking application for competitive coders. With Codephile, you can track your and your friends' progress, be informed about programming contests, and much more!

Find it on Playstore( link in bio)

Happy Coding (...and stalking)

Hi Freshers!

We're holding our Intro Talk this Sunday (20th November), 11AM at the MAC Audi.
Come meet us and find out more about our shenanigansüåªüí´

PS: MDG Space is a team of enthusiastic students who aim to explore, ideate and develop products over a vast range of software technologies in the IIT Roorkee campus and beyond. We have a bunch of software wizards and design sorcerers who enjoy crafting spells with design and code to engineer robust and innovative solutions. We actively foster the open source culture and other tech-based know-how within the campus and all over the world.

Contact:
Secretary- @sick_aada , 7835909580

Hello IITR junta,
Greetings from MDG Space!
We are flooded by the responses for the newly launched 'Appetizer'. Seeing some commonly asked inquiries, we've solved them for you here. Scan the QR or click the link in bio.
For any further queries feel free to contact us.
Join us on slack: https://join.slack.com/t/mdg-open/shared_invite/zt-1jhizcrqt-TrfYLmkX0~I3c_DuDIifpA
Chat with us: https://mdg.iitr.ac.in/chat

Hello IITR Junta,

We present Appetizer, an app that offers real-time mess notifications, a Mess Menu display, and a total amount of meals you can skip and get reimbursed! You even have a place to offer feedback and assist the management in raising the calibre of the cuisine.

With love from MDG Space ‚ù§Ô∏è and the efforts of the Hostel Council, we are pleased to announce the release of "Appetizer" after a long wait.

Link: https://linktr.ee/mdgiitr

Greetings from Hostel Council!

Ever wished to skip a Meal in the Mess? Not able to find the Mess Menu? Agitated by seeing the callous wastage of food? Tired of this constant pandemonium?
With a stroke of genius and moment of ingenuity, Hostel Council has come up with a one touch, or rather one push solution to all your daily headaches, Appetizer.

Appetizer is an app developed by MDG in collaboration with Hostel Council, which brings to you the best of mess experience to your phone with real time notifications, Mess Menu display and a special feature which lets you skip any meal you are not excited about and helps you get a rebate. It also has a self-contained system for feedback and suggestions.
The excruciating wait is finally over as Appetizer is in its final stages of development with last rounds of data collection in process. Soon, Appetizer will grace your mess halls.

Appetizer Loading‚Ä¶

Hey guys!

Want to learn new tech stacks to equip you better for your upcoming job opportunity? The tech groups of STC have come together to take y'all on a journey through the world of contributing to Open Source Software. So, get ready for a month long celebration of contributing to open source including talks, workshops, sprints and other fun stuff! Join us for the talk on 6th to know more.

Also tune in for some cool swag :)

Collaborators: @mdgspace @dsgiitr @ds_iitr @sdslabs @acm_iitroorkee @odyssey.iitr

MDG Space presents "Open Source Odyssey"! A two week long program for first yearites to kickstart their open source journeys. Learn the art of collaboration by working on popular GitHub repositories and solving beginner to intermediate issues with guidance from MDG Space members. Further details and steps on our website: mdgspace.org/open-source-odyssey

Join our Slack: bit.ly/3Q0WUKo

Another successful year in Open Source contributions! Congratulations to @_aman._.singh, @_starboy_24, @burgers.1312, @likeanushkaa and @riya_elizabeth_john for getting selected in prestigious open source programs.

#GSOC #outreachy #MLH #opensourcesoftware

Hey Folks!
Get ready to put your learning caps on, because MDG Space will be conducting an offline #workshop on Servers and APIs on 21st May, 2022, 6:00 pm onwards. Venue: LHC-005

We will be introducing you to the working principles of servers and API handling, this will be followed by a hands-on session where you'll be building a short project using Node.js and Express.

Basic JavaScript will be a prerequisite, everything else will be covered during the workshop.

You are requested to bring your laptops with nvm [github.com/nvm-sh/nvm (For Linux and MacOS), github.com/coreybutler/nvm-windows (For Windows)] and MongoDB [mongodb.com/docs/manual/administration/install-community/] installed to help you follow along and get your doubts cleared on the spot.

Resources will be shared after the workshop. As a bonus, refreshments will also be provided at the end of the session :)

For any queries, feel free to ping us on mdg.iitr.ac.in/chat or our Open Slack space link.mdgspace.org/slack.

#webdevelopment #servers #api #nodejs #expressjs #MongoDB

Congratulations!
You just got .mdg'edüòâ

Hola RLanders!

The season of recruitment is here! After an amazing SoC and tons of other learning opportunities, we‚Äôre happy to announce another shot at getting into MDG Space.

For developers: We have two challenges for first yearites:

1) Assignment
Details about the assignment are here: bit.ly/3KJSVya. The assignment deadline is 20th March, 11:59 PM, so buckle up!

2) Recruitment Test
The recruitment test will be on 20th March from 12 noon to 2 PM. Register for the test here: bit.ly/3q2cWbz. Only registered students will be sent the link for the test, so make sure to do it quickly. Syllabus of the test will consist of aptitude and logical reasoning, programming (not language specific) and other sections to assess your thinking skills.

Although it‚Äôs not compulsory, we highly recommend you to attempt both of these to increase your chances of selection.

For designers: Both 1st and 2nd year students are eligible for designer positions. We have released problem statements for you here: bit.ly/3w3NLJr, which are to be submitted by 20th March, 11:59 PM.

Make sure to be on schedule as no submissions will be accepted post deadline. All the other instructions and resource links are present in the assignments or test itself.

Feel free to ping us on mdg.iitr.ac.in/chat or our open Slack space regarding any doubts.
Hope to see you soon on your stellar journey (pun definitely intended) to MDG Space!

Hey guys!
The Ideation Phase for SoC 2022 has officially started, and we are accepting Proposal submissions now. Please note that there are separate forms for Solo Designers and Team/Solo Developer applicants and fill accordingly.

Solo Designers: https://forms.gle/zPVpnYY2DUetN8127

Teams/Solo Developers: https://forms.gle/dBKL5YrKxw5Bm6bz7

Have doubts regarding how to proceed, or feeling stuck somewhere? Seeing a large number of queries regarding the SoC programme, we are keeping an AMA (Ask me anything) session tomorrow, 2nd February at 6 PM. See you there!

Link for AMA meeting: shorturl.at/dkvDL
PS: We strongly request all interested peeps to also join our Open-Source Slack Workspace (if you haven't yet!)

Hi folks üòÅ
As announced in yesterday's workshop, MDG brings to you Season of Code 2022 (Soc'22), our annual 2-month long Mentorship programme. All you have to do is have an idea, and submit a well-formed project proposal following our guidelines (linked below). If your proposal gets shortlisted, you spend the next 2 months building on your idea and actualising your vision. Read here to get the complete details: https://mdg.iitr.ac.in/soc
Oh yeah, there's one last thing: This time, we're accepting team submissions (1-3 students) - and both developers and designers are welcome ü•≥ (Brownie points for anyone who got the reference!)

Find links in linktree (in bio)

Thank you guys, for actively participating in our workshop series of flutter and making it successful. 

Please find below all the relevant links and resources:

Hey Everyone!

Continuing with our series of workshops on Flutter, MDG Space is conducting our second Workshop on MVVM Architecture and Firebase Services on 30th January, 2022, 5:00 pm onwards.

We'll be streaming our workshop live on our YouTube channel : https://www.youtube.com/c/MDGIITR

If you missed our previous workshop, you can find it here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BFd6syGPvoM
All the resources for it can be found in the video description.

We also recommend you complete the tasks we mentioned in our previous workshop:
1. Installation to your first app: flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install
2. Building UI:  docs.flutter.dev/development/ui/layout/tutorial
3. Adding interactivity: docs.flutter.dev/development/ui/interactive

For any issues, contact us on mdg.iitr.ac.in/chat and join us on our Open Slack Community: https://join.slack.com/t/mdg-open/shared_invite/zt-oda9nlwx-mwwqzjCVRDfyUmuGWVrl7A

See you at the workshop!

‚ÄúThe secret of change is to focus all of your energy not on fighting the old, but on building the new.‚Äù ‚Äì Socrates
At Mobile Development Group our philosophy has always been - ‚ÄúA place where ideas meet reality‚Äù. We converted a lot of ideas into useful mobile applications and the journey has been amazing.
We‚Äôre glad to announce that now we are stepping into MDG Space - A space where we expand our domain to a new ecosystem of technologies aside Mobile tech. We do so under the extension of ".mdg" - an umbrella term for all our projects and activities and a medium for exploration!‚ù§Ô∏è
Check out our brand new website here: https://mdg.iitr.ac.in/

Hello people!

MDG is conducting An Introductory Workshop on Mobile Development using Flutter on 23rd January, 2022 from 5:00 pm.

We'll be streaming our workshop on our Youtube channel : https://www.youtube.com/c/MDGIITR

*Add the event to your calendar using https://bit.ly/3qCCL2o *

Install Android Studio or VS Code if you want to follow along! You can find the steps to install it, here:
Android Studio: https://developer.android.com/studio/install
VS Code: https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/setup/setup-overview

See you at the workshop!

CALENDAR LINK IN BIO!

We are proud to announce that the Security App, developed by MDG & IMG, has been successfully launched at all Campus gates of the Institute.
It is meant to digitalize the entry/exit process at all entrances of the Institute and replace the old cumbersome way of manual entries made by the security guards.

We are delighted to present an android app for RDrive - A shared drive for IITR community.
This app (powered by Channeli) lets the faculty, students, and anyone with an official relation with IIT Roorkee take advantage of free cloud storage space specifically designed to ease their content sharing activities.

The app is now available on Google Play store - https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=in.ac.iitr.mdg.rdrive 

You can have a look at the existing web app available on Channeli here - https://channeli.in/r_drive

So what are you waiting for? Try the RDrive app now and share files securely with your peers without worrying about data privacy. Let us know if you have any suggestions at mdg@iitr.ac.in

Cheers!
MDG

Hola freshers! üòä

Time to get charged up as we are releasing the problem statements of Droid Wars 2021 üíª.

Check out the detailed problem statements, instructions and resources here: http://mdg.iitr.ac.in/droid_wars.html

Since the freshers are busy in academics, we have given ample time for these projects. So just don't put stress on yourself by worrying too much about the deadline üòÖ.

Got any doubts? Feel free to chat with us at mdg.iitr.ac.in/chat

Droid Wars is a competition for Android, iOS and cross-platform developers to have a learning and coding experience by developing a complete mobile application along with direct entry to interview for recruitment.

Cheers‚úå

Greetings!
Hope you and your family are safe at your homes : )

MDG is conducting a talk on Competitive Programming and Placements and here's your chance to interact and learn from the final yearites who have bagged some of the best offers in India.

We will also be introducing our new application, Codephile, which is an application for competitive coders to track their and their friends' progress.
Talk timings: 23rd May, 9:30 PM (Sunday)
Registration Link in bio
Event link will be mailed to you.

See you at the talk!
Cheers!

MDG is extremely proud to share that our alumni Kush Taneja - Founder at Fampay, Shivam Mangla - Founder at rephrase.ai and Akshay Deshraj - Founder at vernacular.ai made it to the Forbes 30 under 30 Asia list, 2021. We extend our heartiest congratulations to all of them for this remarkable achievement and many more such accomplishments to come! ü•≥ü•≥

Hello everyone!

We are glad to announce new additions to the MDG fam. After a rigorous recruitment drive, we finally have our gems and we welcome you with great pleasure. Those who could not make it this time don't lose hope, we will soon be conducting another round of recruitments through Droid Wars. Stay tuned for updates.

Cheers
MDG!

Hey designers! We know you are as much excited about the recruitment drive, as we are to welcome you as a part of our family. Here is the first step in that direction for the designers out there. We have hand-selected some interesting problem statements to get those creative juices flowing.
Check them out here: http://bit.ly/3lqWEWd
Deadline: 27th March 2021, 11:59 PM
Eligibility: 1st and 2nd year

We have included the necessary resources with tasks, but still, if you get stuck anywhere or need some advice, message us on our chat; https://mdg.iitr.ac.in/chat or hop into our open slack community and join #design channel: http://bit.ly/3vCt3O1

Also, we will try to clear all your doubts through our recruitment talk on 19th March (TOMORROW!) at 6:30 PM. So designers, don't forget to attend the talk, and get set go on the design problems!
(All links are available on our fb page too)

The wait is finally over! We at MDG are excited to welcome new members to our family.

Hi guys!
During the course of your time here in R-Land, we‚Äôre sure you've heard of the prestigious Google Summer of Code and Outreachy programmes, conducted yearly during the summer.
The Google Summer of Code(GSoC), and Outreachy(only open for women candidates) are international annual programs, in which stipends are awarded to students who successfully complete a free and open-source software coding project during the summer.
We at MDG are holding a webinar this Wednesday at 7pm, to discuss these programmes, and answer your questions for the same.
Sitting in as panelists for this webinar will be several MDG members who qualified GSoc/Outreachy this year, and they shall discuss their work/experiences.
Registration link is in bioüòÑüíõ

Did you know that the girls in IITR weren't allowed to leave the hostels after 11 PM, a few years ago?( Yeah! Our campus was much so called #sanskari back thenüôÑ)
But now things have changed-because of an actual protest in IITR against such policies!
So here we present a short story of the legendary #Pinjra_Tod_Movement in R-land by Aashaka Shah who witnessed and what a part of this change .
Stay tuned for the full upcoming interview on MDG talks!üòÑ
